title: Get points for sharing knowledge
description: 共通の知識をオンラインで提供する人々は、その成功を共有することはほとんどなく、最新の状態に保つためのインセンティブも限られています。

f6_assessments.q0: Using NFTs to represent ownership of IP and reward set owners for contributions, does address the challenge as the proposal do have NFTs at the heart of the business model. I would like the team to refine the problem statement, maybe Problem: Common knowledge sharing is not rewarded, Solution: Tokenize the knowledge as NFT and reward contributors...? I feel the team is proposing a 'wikipedia' via NFT, as such I would like the team to think about how they will attract users to the platform and how they will encourage users to pay to access the NFT instead of going to current online alternatives.
f6_assessments.q1: Although a link to a website was provided, I feel the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. I would like the team to further expand on the type and number of team members required to fully implement the proposal, what are the responsibilities and deliverables of each member. I would like to see links to LinkedIn or similar to provide additional detail/evidence about the team work history, education and past experiences. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed". Lastly, I would like the team to expand on the plan for scaling and future funding.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a minimal roadmap and budget. I would like to see the team develop Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) (mint 25 guides by month 6, mint 60 guides by Month 7, etc - create measurables) for the project based on a monthly timetable and connect the KPIs to milestones on the project roadmap (timeline) . I would like to see the team create a thorough roadmap -  develop and add milestones to provide deeper detail, set technical development milestones for creating the product. I would like to see the budget developed beyond single line entries and broken down into monthly spending, and I would like the team to connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the spending, what are the specific tasks and deliverables that the developers must provide and when must they deliver the tasks – this breakdown will give a clearer indication about the implementation workload feasibility and match the deliverables to the spending - thus the team can track performance and spending over a timeline. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think it's a great idea and I believe ideas along these lines will be successful in future.  The reason for the neutral rating is that I don't think the proposal effectively addresses the challenge in that it does not really touch on business models, nor on how it can help to distinguish Cardano, though to be fair it does help "undistinguish" Cardano as a platform that now supports smart contracts.

I would have loved to have seen the idea developed in more detail with respect to business models.  While I think it's interesting and useful to develop a user interface, I feel this would be more effective if informed by more detailed thinking about the business model.

For example, I think the design of the user interface might be quite different depending on details of the ownership and transfer model.  Would a contributor gain ownership at the expense of current owner(s) stake in the content?  Would those owners feel motivated to give up that ownership?  Might it be better to grant ownership based on signals from other users?  What would the "cost" be to those users?  What would the benefits be?
f6_assessments.q1: Very little detail is given about the team, experience, etc.  35 combined years doesn't tell us much (e.g., it does not say how many people are on the team, what skills they have, whether they would expect to undertake the work themselves or contract it out, etc.)  This makes it difficult to assess whether the proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: I would prefer to see more detail around the specific milestones, what would constitute successful completion, etc.   While one can perhaps imagine what artifacts might be presented in support of the first milestone, the second is much more open ended.

f6_assessments.q0: This provides a business model that is non-art and would bring adoption to cardano. It allows user to take part in the success and be rewarded, as well as promote a community of knowledge sharing which could lead to more NFT business models on cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan presented does not provided much background details on their team besides stated years of experience. It is not clear if they intend to go through with phase 2 with this funding or request more funding later. They request funds that look like they are, but in the proposal it states when they reach phase 2 they are unsure of the remaining budget.
f6_assessments.q2: It only provides general measurables with some time frames. It does not provide a clear way to audit success aside from a working POC following the completon of phase 1.
f6_assessments.reply: The score matches the limited rational provided and it has a couple of correct and one or 2 even helpful observations. However, the CA's respose is not much of a considered assessment statement. It misses bringing in experience from the assessor, advice for the proposer, and reflection of having understood the porposer's intend in context of the challenge.
